title: Bug 38131: ajc needs the -d option to correctly compile classes from a subpackage
OB: After compiling, a directory named 'subpackage' is created under the existing 'subpackage' directory.
EB: The 'subpackage' directory should not be created under the existing 'subpackage' directory.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create the specified class in the specified subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command 'ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java'.
